ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:0.2_0: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:0.4_0: The training rule on those who conceal offenses
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.2_0: At that time the nun Sundarīnandā was pregnant by Migāra’s grandson Sāḷha.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.3_0: When the fetus got large, she concealed her condition.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.4_0: And when the fetus was fully grown, she disrobed and gave birth.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.5_0: The nuns said to the nun Thullanandā,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.6_0: “Venerable, Sundarīnandā gave birth shortly after disrobing.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.7_0: “Could it be that she was pregnant while she was still a nun?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.9_0: “But why did you know that a nun had committed an offense entailing expulsion, but neither confront her herself nor tell a group of nuns?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.10_0: “Her disrepute is my disrepute, her infamy is my infamy, her notoriety is my notoriety, her loss is my loss.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.11_0: Why would I tell others of my own disrepute, infamy, notoriety, and loss?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.12_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.13_0: “How could Venerable Thullanandā, knowing that a nun had committed an offense entailing expulsion, neither confront her herself nor tell a group of nuns?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.14_0: Those nuns then told the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.16_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.17_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā acted like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.20_0: “... How could the nun Thullanandā, knowing that a nun had committed an offense entailing expulsion, neither confront her herself nor tell a group of nuns?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.21_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.22_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:1.23.1_0: ‘If a nun knows that a nun has committed an offense entailing expulsion, but she neither confronts her herself nor tells a group of nuns, and afterward—whether that nun remains or has died or has been expelled or has converted—she says, “Venerables, although I previously knew that this nun was like this, I thought, ‘I will neither confront her myself nor tell a group of nuns,’” she too is expelled and excluded from the community. The training rule on those who conceal offenses.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.6_0: she knows by herself or others have told her or she has told her.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.7_0: Has committed an offense entailing expulsion:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.8_0: she has committed any one of the eight offenses entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.10_0: she does not accuse her herself.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.11_0: Nor tells a group of nuns:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.12_0: she does not tell other nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.13_0: Whether that nun remains or has died:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.15_0: Has died: what is meant is that she has passed away.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.17_0: she has either disrobed herself or been expelled by others.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.19_0: what is meant is that she has joined another religious community.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.20_0: Afterward she says, “Venerables, although I previously knew that this nun was like this, I thought, ‘I will neither confront her myself’”:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.25_0: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.27_0: just as a fallen, withered leaf is incapable of becoming green again, so a nun who knows that a nun has committed an offense entailing expulsion, but who thinks, “I will neither confront her myself nor tell a group of nuns,” by the mere fact of giving up her duty, is not an ascetic, not a daughter of the Sakyan.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.27_1: The offenses entailing expulsion is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.29_0: Living together, one jointly joins, in concorducive to the community together: this is called “excluded from the community”.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.1.30_0: She does not take part in this—therefore it is called “excluded from the community”.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.2_0: if she does not tell because she thinks there will be quarrels or disputes in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.3_0: if she does not tell because she thinks there will be a schism or fracture in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.4_0: if she does not tell because she thinks the person she is telling about is cruel and harsh and that she might become a danger to life or to the living of the spiritual life;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.5_0: if she does not tell because she does not see any suitable nuns;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.6_0: if she does not tell, but not because she wants to conceal;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.7_0: if she does not tell because she thinks the other person will be known through her own actions;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.11_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj6:2.2.12_0: The sixth offense entailing expulsion is finished.
